text: now here's the kitchen conundrum I know
we all have we go to the farmers market
we have every intention of using those
beautiful bunches of herbs that we
purchase but sometimes they end up in
the produce drawer of your refrigerator
and they just go to waste so I'm going
to show you some money saving tips right
now on how you can preserve your herbs
in many different ways and I'm going to
start with basil because this is an herb
that really does kind of deteriorate
quickly so when you bring it home from
the market trim off the ends just like
you would cut flowers so they can really
absorb some water and what I like to do
is trim off the rubber band and right
into a tall glass of water so now take
that produce bag that maybe you purchase
the basil in and this goes over the top
of the basil and around the sides and
now give it a little bit of a tie so it
kind of seals in the air and it acts
almost like a little miniature
greenhouse and this will extend the life
of your basil for one or two days even
up to a week if the temperatures just
right
leave it out at room temperature don't
put it in your refrigerator and there
you have it so now you know how to store
a basil for the short term and most
people they store basil for the long
term at pesto in their freezer but it's
not just basil you can do it with so
many other herbs and I'm going to show
you three variations that you're going
to love so the classic combination would
be basil pesto so basil pine nuts garlic
and Parmesan cheese you can do a parsley
variation that has almonds garlic and a
little bit of orange peel mint is a
really fantastic herb to use in a pesto
and paired with pistachios garlic and
lemon zest is really great I'm going to
show you the other combination and that
is cilantro so I have three cups of
packed cilantro leaves in a food
processor quarter of a cup of toasted
cashews one garlic clove that's smashed
and if you like heat chili this is a red
Fresno chili and I'm going to just chop
this up a little bit get it started just
into some pieces here salt and pepper
and I'm just going to chop this up and
add a little bit of olive oil
now you need about a half a cup of olive
oil here just enough to form a paste wow
it smells really delicious and this
would be fantastic if you stir it into a

has a lot of flavor it packs a punch and
my favorite way to store pesto is in the

little cubes just like this you can pop
out one cubit of thyme and use it per
recipe so there you have it
pesto four ways so now the third and
final way to preserve herbs this method
is for long term storage and that is
drying your herbs out in the microwave
I have mint here time you could use sage
you could use rosemary you could use
tarragon parsley any herb really and you
want to spread them out on just a single
layer of paper towels but make sure that
the herbs do not overlap because that
will encourage them to steam instead of
dry and then we're going to go into the
microwave with a paper towel right on
top and that just helps to absorb any
excess moisture now right into the
microwave for about a minute at 20
second intervals check to make sure that
they're doing okay and you want them to
be dry crisp and still vibrant green
so it's been about a minute DeMint is
dry it's crisp it still has that
wonderful green color and this is done
you can store them in these little glass
jars and they will last for a very long
time now you want to make sure that you
seal them well enjoy them in a cool dark
place somewhere where there's no
humidity so that your herbs stay nice
and dry and there you have it three
wonderful ways and preserve your herbs
and your kitchen conundrum is solved
